unparsed_output: The lungs can be seen on either side of the heart in the image. The lungs are typically light in color and have a distinctive shape that allows them to expand and contract during breathing. They are located in the chest cavity, alongside the heart. The lungs are responsible for exchanging oxygen and carbon dioxide through the process of respiration. They play a crucial role in maintaining proper oxygen levels in the body and removing waste products. In the image, the lungs appear as two dark-colored objects on either side of the heart, indicating their location and function.
